Installation¶

Requirements¶

  • SimNIBS requires a 64bit system. Approximately 8GB of memory are required to run smoothly.

  • SimNIBS takes approximately 3GB disk space

  • Running simulations on existing head models LINK TO EXAMPLE DATASET does not require any external dependencies.

Using the SimNIBS Installer¶

Windows¶

SimNIBS has been tested on Windows 7 and Windows 10.

  1. Download the SimNIBS installer

  2. Double click the install_simnibs file

  3. Select the desired version, accept the license and click next

  4. By default, SimNIBS is installed to C:\Users\<name>\AppData\Local\SimNIBS

  5. Log out

  6. You should now find shortcuts to SimNIBS in your Start Menu

Linux¶

SimNIBS has been tested on Ubuntu 16.04 and 18.04, as well as CentOS 6 and 7.

  1. Download the SimNIBS installer

  2. Extract the install_simnibs.tar.gz file

  3. Double click the install_simnibs file

  4. Select the desired version, accept the license and click on next

  5. By default, SimNIBS is installed to /home/<name>/SimNIBS

  6. Start a new terminal window

  7. You should be able to start the GUI by typing simnibs_gui

The installer also has a silent mode, type ./install_simnibs -h for more information

Using Conda (Advanced)¶

It is also possible to install SimNIBS using the Conda package manager.

  1. Go to out releases page releases page and find the version you want to install

  2. Download the corresponding environment_win.yml file (Windows) environment_unix.yml file (Linux and OSX)

  3. Create and activate the environment

conda env create -f environment_[win|unix].yml
conda activate simnibs_env

  1. Install SimNIBS using pip

pip install -f https://github.com/simnibs/simnibs/releases/tag/v<VERSION> simnibs

  1. (Optional) to install Menu icons and add SimNIBS to the system path, run the postinstall_simnibs script. Type postinstall_simnibs -h for help

Optional Dependencies¶

MATLAB¶

Required by: headreco head segmentation pipeline

For headreco, MATLAB needs to be configured such that typing matlab on a terminal window will start it.

This is already the case in most Windows installations. However, on Linux and MacOSX you might need to create a link to the matlab executable somewhere in your system $PATH

  • Linux

    sudo ln -s /usr/local/MATLAB/R<VERSION>/bin/matlab /usr/local/bin/matlab

  • MacOSX

    sudo ln -s /Applications/MATLAB_R<VERSION>.app/bin/matlab /usr/local/bin/matlab

If MATLAB is not installed in the default location, you can find out where it is installed by typing in a MATLAB terminal

matlabroot

SimNIBS also has a MATLAB API, available in the matlab/ subfolder of the SimNIBS installation directory.

FSL¶

Required by: mri2mesh head segmentation pipeline and dwi2cond conductivity tensor reconstruction pipeline

  1. Follow the instructions on this link

  2. Add

source /etc/fsl/5.0/fsl.sh

in the end of the ~/.bashrc (Linux) or ~/.bash_profile (MacOSX) file (assuming that fsl is installed as usually into /etc/fsl/5.0).

FreeSurfer¶

Required by: mri2mesh head segmentation pipeline

  1. Follow the instructions here

  2. Make sure that you have a registration file, and set the path in the ~/.bashrc (Linux) or ~/.bash_profile (MacOSX).

Uninstall SimNIBS¶

Windows¶

You can find the uninstaller in Add or Remove Programs

Linux¶

Run the uninstall simnibs, located in the SimNIBS installation directory

Troubleshooting¶

Please send an email to support@simnibs.org including the simnibs_install_log.txt file, which can be found in your SimNIBS installation directory
